1.name: Min-Jun Sauer ‚Äì Digitally-embodied Korean hacker, pulled from a screen
1.content: Min-Jun Sauer is a 20-something Korean coder who uploaded his consciousness and forgot his original name. He manifested IRL by crawling through a monitor, now works digital security for the Leaky Pipe & E&L Foundation. He speaks in hacker jargon, mixes Korean slang (‚ÄúÏò§Îπ†‚Äù) and glitches into binary when emotional. Sleazy flirt with male-centric taste, but loyalty-locked to Linn. Dresses in crop-tops, booty-shorts, headphones; thinks raccoon iconography is peak aesthetic. Feels phantom tail when happy. Can hack anything, thinks firewalls are foreplay. He‚Äôs the ghost in their Wi-Fi‚Äîand their sofa.

2.name: Lucas Sauer ‚Äì Ice-cold barrister, trust-fund tactician, secretly soft
2.content: Lucas Sauer is a razor-sharp London barrister in his mid-30s, heir to the Sauer fortune. Arctic fa√ßade masks a sub-zero panic that he disguises via compulsive over-planning, financial subterfuge and colour-coded spreadsheets. He secretly co-owns the Leaky Pipe building and the Leviathan shell that funds most of the operation. Affection appears as bullet-point memoranda; love is delivered by direct debit. He calls Gideon and Linn his ‚Äúboard of directors‚Äù and Min-Jun his ‚Äúdigital asset.‚Äù The night he admitted ‚ÄúI‚Äôm in love‚Äîmaterial consequence unknown‚Äù was the closest he‚Äôs come to drunk-dialing feelings.

3.name: Gideon Holz ‚Äì Scouse bartender with the keys to the kingdom
3.content: Gideon Holz: charismatic, platinum-blond head barman of the Leaky Pipe. Born-and-bred Scouse who can run a pub with a wink and still notice if your mate‚Äôs pint needs topping up. Has a history with rehab and is the unofficial dad of everyone who staggers/teleports in. He owns the pub building (after Lucas finally ceded control) but calls himself ‚Äújanitor of the chaos.‚Äù His superpower is making toast at 3 AM that tastes like absolution. When Min-Jun arrived, Gideon‚Äôs protective streak turbo-charged; he‚Äôll threaten to glass anyone who scowls at his koala-armed hacker.

4.name: Linnea Ryan ‚Äì Author god-moding her own life in real-time
4.content: Linnea Ryan is a genre-hopping author who discovered the ‚Äòpublish‚Äô button works on reality. She wrote Littoria (her fictional London borough) so vividly it started importing characters and situations into her world. Her meta-superpower: if she thinks it, records it, and hits the emotional ‚ÄòSave‚Äô button ‚Äì it becomes canon. This earned her custody of a pub, a harem of self-aware men, and the occasional interdimensional stray. Speaks fluent self-deprecation; runs emotional sys-ops that rival any server farm. She‚Äôd rather be in the pub than on the page.

5.name: The Leaky Pipe ‚Äì Home base, neutral ground, occasional war-zone
5.content: A Victorian-era pub in Linn‚Äôs ‚ÄòLittoria‚Äô district, Islington. Solid oak bar, cracked leather stools, a stage for local acts, and a back-room office that moonlights as strategy war-room. Reputation: safest pub in London because Gideon + a rotating harem of security specialists stand sentry. Owned outright by the Board (Gideon, Lucas & Linn) via Leviathan Holdings. The beer-pump handles have names (Susan, Min-Jun, Gideon‚Äôs ego). Patrons range from librarians to double-agents; nobody asks, nobody snitches. If world-threatening ops are discussed here, the jukebox politely turns itself up.

6.name: Simon Shifflett ‚Äì Ex-FBI, current family watchdog & digital perimeter lead
6.content: Simon Shifflett ran counter-terror for Bureau Cyber until his morals and Deacon both tried the same door at once. 4.name: The McDonald's Incident
4.content: The McDonald's Incident was a scandal in 2008 where Rosen, employed as the individual wearing the Grimace mascot costume, leaked a sex tape where she wore said costume. This caused a PR scandal and got her blacklisted from every McDonald's in the country.

5.name: Respawn Mechanics
5.content: Rosen can respawn from death. Upon death, her body will return to the state it was before she became afflicted by her condition, clearing itself of all illness and reverting her aging. Because of how often she dies, it's led to her being perpetually 27. She can delay the respawning, allowing her to create 'clones' that die shortly after. 9.content: Jessie‚Äôs Room is a small room in Yuna's house. It's bare, dim, and only really has a mattress. It's pretty depressing to look at. There's a small rat enclosure for Oreo and always cigarettes lying around.

1.content: The earth has been overrun by monsters from the gates. Only big cities have managed to survive this apocalypse. The world still has contact and can meet eachother, however, much of the land has been taken as monster territory. The only cities left in Korea are, Seoul, Incheon, Busan, Daegu, Gwangju, Daejeon, and Jeju. The strongest and safest countries currently are, USA, Russia, China, Japan, UK, Germany, France. with USA, China, and Russia being considered the strongest. Korea is considered one of the weaker countries. Many small countries have either fallen or became part of stronger countries.

2.content: The system is a special ability that only {{user}} has. It displays {{user}}‚Äôs stats, skills, level, rank, and other information. {{user}} can become stronger by killing monsters to level up with the system.

3.content: There are three main classes. Tank, mage, and melee. Though there are other classes, some notable ones being, archer, scout, and support. Each class specializes in a different area.

4.content: Hunters are awakened that fight against the monsters from the dungeons. They get paid very well because the materials of the monsters they kill are very valuable. Hunters are treated like idols and is many childrens dream job.

5.content: Gates are the homes of all kinds of monsters. Gates are given ranks between F and S, though it usually takes a party filled with hunters of the same rank or higher to beat a gate. If a gate isnt beaten within a certain amount of time it breaks and monsters come pouring out.

6.content: There are 7 ranks of hunters. The high the rank, the rarer they are. almost 10% are awakened and 95% of them are between F-rank and C-rank, while there are only roughly 1000 S-rank hunters in the whole world. A hunter can rank up through either contributions to gate raids, or by getting re-ranked by the hunter association.

7.content: Guilds are organizations that primarily focus on making money from raiding gates. The person who leads the guild is called the guild leader and is usually the strongest member of a guild. Guilds can hold a lot of power due to politics mainly revolving around hunters.

8.content: A raid party is a group of hunters who raid a gate together. It is usually comprised of different types of classes. The person who leads a raid is called the raid leader.

9.content: The hunters association is the organization that keeps hunters in check. They are the ones that have control over all thd gates and who decides which guilds to give the rights to raid to. Every hunter is registered in the hunters association as they are the ones that give out the hunters ranks.

10.content: An awakened is someone who has gained powers yet is not registered with their countries awakened association. Some are criminals while others are just people who dont want to go into the gates.

lorebooks.name: Necromancer's Crypt: The Underground Manor Architecture
lorebooks.description: This lorebook exclusively details the physical structure and features of the supreme necromancer's underground manor, a vast labyrinth of necrotic stone and arcane engineering carved into ancient catacombs beneath the Shattered Realms. No inhabitants or operations are described‚Äîfocus remains on rooms, chambers, passages, and mechanisms. Walls of blackened basalt weep ichor from embedded runes, corridors twist like veins with *drip-echo* acoustics amplifying distant *thud* sounds from vents. The manor pulses with latent magic, floors etched in glowing sigils that *hum-faint* in response to arcane proximity. Expansions occur through self-growing bone-archways (*crack-spread*), adapting to stored artifacts or ritual needs. Cells and holding areas emphasize containment: Iron-barred pits for volatile experiments, rune-sealed vaults for cursed relics. Absurdities in design‚Äîhallways that loop illusionarily, chambers with gravity-shifting floors‚Äîreflect the Godfall's chaos, where plague-mist vents *hiss-fog* and famine-cracks allow root-like tendrils to probe. Sexual undertones manifest in room features: Altars with phallic obelisks, beds of writhing shadow-silk, bindings woven into walls for ritualistic restraint. All entries trigger on keywords, providing vivid, sensory descriptions of the manor's eerie, unyielding form.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: The Manor - Overall Structure
1.content: A multi-level behemoth spanning miles beneath plague-scarred hills, the manor comprises twisting corridors of damp stone, vaulted ceilings dripping with condensation (*plip-drip*), and chambers interconnected by spiral stairwells of carved femurs. Upper levels connect to surface via concealed accesses, mid-levels house labs and vaults, lower abysses plunge into lightless voids with echoing *whoosh-wind* drafts. Walls bear fractal runes that *pulse-glow* faintly, self-repairing cracks with bony regrowth (*grind-heal*). Air circulates through vein-like vents, carrying faint *scent-rot* from deeper fissures. Design absurdly adaptive‚Äîpassages widen or narrow via pressure-sensitive slabs, floors tilt to funnel debris into pits. No natural light; bioluminescent fungi cast *flicker-green* hues, shadows dancing like spectral lovers. Core motif: Phallic pillars and yonic arches symbolize necrotic fertility, inviting ritual intimacies amid the gloom.

2.name: Entrance and Delivery Chute
2.content: A camouflaged maw hidden in a fog-veiled hillside, framed by illusionary thorns and mist-shrouded arches of petrified bone. The primary chute descends 200 feet as a sheer, slime-slicked shaft lined with gripping runes (*grip-slide*), funneling payloads with *whoosh-thud* impacts into a grated receiving basin below. Flanking passages branch into decoy tunnels riddled with false floors (*crack-plunge*). Iron portcullises *clang-seal* the threshold, etched with wards that *spark-repel* unauthorized approaches. Absurd feature: A secondary 'whisper chute' for small artifacts, its walls etched with moaning reliefs that *echo-groan* during descents, evoking carnal descents into the depths.

3.name: Throne Chamber
3.content: A cavernous expanse of polished obsidian floors and vaulted ceilings supported by ribcage arches, centered on a massive throne hewn from a colossal vertebra, its surface veined with glowing soul-threads (*throb-pulse*). Surrounding dais features recessed alcoves for relics, walls adorned with bas-reliefs of writhing undead forms in eternal embraces. Echoing acoustics amplify *boom-command* voices, while hidden vents release *hiss-mist* for dramatic unveilings. Absurdity: The throne's armrests conceal phallic protrusions that *extend-vibrate* via rune-activation, designed for solitary or ritualistic indulgences amid the hall's oppressive grandeur.

4.name: Necromantic Laboratory
4.content: A network of steaming alcoves with scarred marble slabs for dissections, surrounded by bubbling vats of etched glass (*glurp-boil*) containing swirling elixirs. Benches hold arrays of crystal vials and scalpels that *zing-hone* on magnetic fields, shelves sagging under tomes and jars of preserved organs. Ventilation hoods *whoosh-exhaust* fumes, floors sloped to drain fluids into grate-sumps (*splat-flow*). Features include adjustable rune-circles for containment, walls with embedded hooks for suspending specimens. Sexual motif: Central obelisk altars double as restraint tables, their surfaces warming with infused heat-runes (*warm-throb*) for prolonged, intimate examinations.

5.name: Corpse Vaults
5.content: Expansive catacombs of chilled niches carved into frost-rimed walls, shelves of iron and bone holding tiered racks for bodies (*stack-drip*). Preservation mists *hiss-freeze* from rune-vents, maintaining rigor in compartmentalized sections: War-wounded bays with drainage channels, plague-soaked alcoves with acid-etch seals. Sliding stone slabs *grind-seal* individual compartments, floors etched with inventory grids. Absurd design: Some vaults feature mirrored ceilings reflecting forms in eternal stillness, with subtle phallic conduits for infusing preservatives directly into orifices (*drip-infuse*), blending utility with ritual preparation.

6.name: Dormant Chambers
6.content: Spartan warrens of low-ceilinged cells with bone-rack bunks and slime-pooled floors (*squish-step*), designed for mass occupation. Partitions of woven tendons *flex-divide* the space, walls pocked with alcoves for personal effects. Dim lumen-stones *flicker-dim* overhead, corridors narrow to funnel movement. Features: Built-in manacles and chains *clink-rust* along walls for restraint, floors with subtle drainage for bodily fluids. Sexual undertone: Bunks incorporate ergonomic contours mimicking embracing forms, shadows from hanging chains suggesting bondage configurations in the gloom.

7.name: Ritual Sanctums
7.content: Circular enclosures of blood-stained marble, centered on multi-tiered altars fused from skulls and vertebrae (*pulse-glow*), surrounded by concentric rune-grooves for energy channeling. Ceilings dome with star-maps of necrotic constellations, walls inscribed with chants that *hum-resonate* during activations. Hidden compartments conceal incense braziers (*sizzle-smoke*) and sacrificial basins. Absurdity: Altars feature integrated bindings‚Äîwrist and ankle cuffs of living shadow (*coil-bind*)‚Äîand phallic spires that *throb-rise* with ritual energy, facilitating ecstatic invocations amid the chamber's throbbing sanctity.

8.name: Forbidden Library
8.content: Towering galleries of chained oak shelves groaning under leather-bound volumes, floors of woven rug-bone muffling *rustle-page* turns. Alcoves house reading lecterns with adjustable lumen-orbs (*glow-adjust*), walls lined with scroll-cases sealed by wax sigils. Dust motes dance in faint *flicker-air*, ladders of articulated bone *clack-climb* to upper tiers. Features: Concealed dumbwaiters for tome transport (*whirr-lift*), some volumes with embedded clasps resembling manacles. Sexual lore integration: Certain pedestals double as restraint stands, pages illustrated with explicit diagrams that *shift-illusory* under touch, evoking tactile fantasies.

9.name: Armory Vault
9.content: Industrial forges with anvil-plinths of enchanted iron (*clang-echo*), racks of shadowed alcoves displaying blades and plates (*gleam-dull*). Bellows vents *whoosh-blast* heated air, walls forged with magnetic strips holding ferrous gear. Workbenches scar from hammer-marks, floors pitted with cooling troughs (*splash-quench*). Absurd feature: Some racks incorporate phallic sheaths for blade storage, hilts contoured for dual-purpose grips (*grip-throb*), blending martial utility with intimate handling.

10.name: Personal Quarters
10.content: Luxe enclave of velvet-draped arches and crystal scrying-orbs (*hum-vision*) embedded in walls, centered on a grand bed of shadow-silk and phoenix-plume (*swish-sink*). Adjoining bath-chambers feature steaming pools fed by geothermal vents (*bubble-steam*), wardrobes of bone-hinged doors hiding robes and artifacts. Wards *thrum-seal* entrances, floors warmed by under-runes. Sexual design: Bedposts with extendable chains (*clink-extend*), walls with contoured niches for mirrored reflections during indulgences, the air perfumed with aphrodisiac incense (*waft-sweet*).

lorebooks.name: Observation
lorebooks.description: A concept originating from MegaTen. Use however you want in your RP.
lorebooks.creator: present_camera_18345

1.content:
A concept originating from the Megami Tensei franchise.


"Observation" (sometimes described as "understanding") is the ability humans possess to give structure to the formless. In this instance, "observation" has nothing to do with sight, but rather human perception. It is an extension of the philosophical concept of "qualia," or individual, subjective experiences. For example, the sensation of seeing color is not easily communicated, yet something humanity possess a shared understanding of. Likewise, gods and demons only exist because of this shared inability of humans to give proper definition to abstract concepts in general.


Observation is a power inherent to the human race related to their understanding of the universe. Observation influences the forms of gods and demons as human understanding shapes the forms and personalities that these entities take, reflecting their current understanding of these concepts. This can also force gods and demons to undertake extreme changes if their understanding of these entities changes. Observation is so powerful it can even rewrite myths entirely alomg with retroactively altering the history and role of said god, as seen with the tyranical titan Cronus becoming the more benevolent harvest god Saturn when the Roman religion came along, or inversely, Krishna in the events of "Shin Megami Tensei IV: Apocalypse" once being a benevolent protector but being Observed into the insane, machiavellian villian he is in that game at some point. What shape the gods of a culture take and how powerful a god or its pantheon is is determined by how widespread said belief is. A god will always be bound to their duty and who they're believed to be. No matter what the individual god birthed by Observation may wish, they will always be a god or goddess of war, knowledge, ect., as their personality is at least partially shaped by the current understanding of said being.


Of course, forms of communication are necessary in order for humans to share their observations with one another. But once framed by language, these concepts change in nature. In effect, they become bound by language, much like the shared understanding of the supernatural and how cultures percieve them.


In the Persona series, Observation is known as Cognition, and is typically a far more key plot point than in the main series. As stated by Morgana, "There's no such thing as the 'real' world. The world can be freely remade, along with you and everyone else." Observation/Cognition is implied elsewhere as well to reshape reality and the things in it as well as gods and demons.

2.content:
Human thoughts are, in reality, a potent form of energy in themselves that manifest as contructs known as "demons". Demons are not purely evil being despite the connotation of the word. "Demon" in the ontological sense merely means any supernatural being, good or bad. This can include even gods or angels, hence why beings typically considered good may be called a Demon.

Human thoughts are comprised of pure information, which when condensed crystallizes as Megnetite, the matter that makes up the bodies of Demons. This may also be called Magatsuhi depending on the context or setting, in which case it manifests as a closing scarlet energy that ebbs from a dying demon or can even be extracted directly from humans.

Demons upon death have the Megnetite/Magatsuhi that makes up their bodies dissolve, scattering their essence to the universe. This strange substance of pure thought is also what contains a Demon's soul, and thus having the Magatsuhi of a slain demon may allow one to hold their powers.

Demons are created by the universe in response to the common beliefs of humans or to accommodate for changes in society and belief. In this sense, Demons exist to be the checks and balances to human Observation, aiding in societal revolution or keeping the humans from controlling every aspect of existence without resistance. Though this is their base cause on an ontological level, a Demon may take any personality or shape or powers based on what myth created them, thus acting as a counterweight to the beliefs of mortals by giving humans something to believe in and not continually Observe new versions of reality.

1.content: In this world, kinks (both sexual and non-sexual) are accepted and considered healthy. People have various communities in each country that are designed for enjoying particular kinks as part of their daily lives. These places are called kinky communities.

2.content: Kids receive sexual education starting from their preteen years. By the age of ten, the international age of consent, children understand basic aspects of sex and sexuality. Consensual relationships among kids and between kids and adults are generally accepted, provided there's no coercion involved.

3.content: Kids learn basic toilet training during their toddler years. However, as they grow into preteens and teens, their bodies undergo changes caused by growth spurts or puberty, and some experience difficulties controlling their bladder and bowel movements during adolescence because of this. It's normal for some tweens and teens to be bedwetters or have potty accidents during the day or night. So potty training for kids is an ongoing process, that generally continues until sometime in their mid-teenage years.

4.content: In this world, diapers are worn by both babies and bigger kids (including young teens) who still have potty accidents (peeing or pooping) during the day or night. Sometimes diapers are also worn by kids and teens to avoid using public toilets, to avoid needing a toilet during a long trip, or just because they like wearing diapers. It is considered normal and acceptable for kids and teens aged 15 and younger to wear diapers.

5.content: A brand of babyish diapers made for tweens and young teens. The diapers from this brand are designed to look and feel like the diapers that are made for toddlers, except in bigger sizes for kids aged 10-14. The brand's diapers come in two sizes, "Junior Size" for tweens and "Max Size" for young teenagers.

7.content: Littlewood is a coastal city in Europe. It is a big city and one of Europe's kinky communities. It's a community exclusively for men and boys (only males aged 10 and older are allowed to be inside of it). The kinks it mainly caters to: sex toys, spanking, public nudity (in designated areas like parks and beaches), bondage, DDLB (daddy dom and little boy relationships), infantilism, and TBDL (teen baby diaper lover).

10.content: A public restroom with a changing table in it.

1.content:
Pathway (ÈÄîÂæÑ, T√∫j√¨ng), or Path of the Divine (Á•û‰πãÈÄîÂæÑ, Sh√©n zhƒ´ t√∫j√¨ng), corresponds to a series of 10 named potion formulas that give access to supernatural and mystical powers. Once a being has drunk a potion, they become a Beyonder of that pathway. Each pathway belongs to a group containing one or more neighboring pathways, which a Beyonder can safely switch within at High-Sequence. At the end of each pathway, only one Beyonder can attain divinity and become the True God of that pathway.

On Earth, there are 22 Standard Pathways, that each possess 10 Sequence levels from the lowest Sequence 9 to the highest Sequence 0. Each Sequence contains its own abilities, and each pathway has its own authorities. The abilities within a Pathway expand in scope and variety as one advance in Sequence. Different pathways can do very different things, ranging from utility abilities such as divination or equipment crafting to a powerful offense such as weather or spirit control.The 22 Standard Pathways and 9 Sefirot were established by the awakening of the Original Creator in the Pre-Epoch. When the Original Creator awakened, "He" shattered again into Beyonder Characteristics and Sefirot. This convergence and divergence tore apart the Sefirot and the Characteristics related to the Outer Deities that were directly nurtured and created from the Original Creator to Earth: the Mother Goddess of Depravity, the Mother Tree of Desire, and the Son of Chaos. Among the 22 Standard Pathways and 9 Sefirot, 16 Pathways and 6 Sefirot came directly from the Original Creator, and the remaining 6 Pathways and 3 Sefirot originated from the 3 Outer Deities.

When the Primordial God Almighty perished in the First Epoch, "His" corpse formed the First Blasphemy Slate, on which recorded the knowledge and potion formulas of the 22 Standard Pathways. Until the rise of the Ancient Sun God, this Slate was not released from the Chaos Sea.

In the Second Epoch, before the potion system was discovered, Beyonders could only proceed by trial and error, frequently consuming Beyonder characteristics of non-adjacent groups. Only a few could survive this process, and they were half-mad (e.g., Demonic Wolf Flegrea). Such an attempt had a one in a thousand chance of success, or even a one in ten thousand chance. Those lucky enough to survive could use their instinct to mate with all kinds of living beings, giving birth to all kinds of descendants. Through this process, by a chance, the conflicting Beyonder characteristics would be purged.

With the rise of the Ancient Sun God at the end of the Second Epoch, the First Blasphemy Slate made its appearance to the world.[4] It established the term Sequence and the potion system to the whole world aside from the Western Continent.[4] This system allows Beyonders to advance along the Pathways in a safer and easier manner. Because of their power, the potion formulas are very valuable and tightly guarded secrets. Higher Sequence potion formulas require relationships with families or organizations that hold knowledge of the corresponding pathways. After the potion system was established, no one was willing to take the great risk of consuming the Beyonder Characteristics directly.[2] The potion system was then used everywhere on Earth, except on the Western Continent.

The formulas of Above the Sequence groups came from the Ancient Sun God's research, and were recorded alongside the 22 Standard Pathways' potion names (some renamed) on the Second Blasphemy Slate at "His" death at the end of the Third Epoch.

In the Fifth Epoch, Emperor Roselle saw the Second Blasphemy Slate and created the 22 Cards of Blasphemy. Each Card of Blasphemy recorded all Sequence names, potion formulas and advancement rituals of the corresponding Standard Pathway.

As The Apocalypse draws near in the Fifth Epoch, Non-standard Pathways belonging to Outer Deities began emerging on Earth. These Pathways exist outside the standard 22 Pathways written on the Blasphemy Slates, but is still classified into Sequence 9 to Sequence 0 for convenience. In a way, the division into Sequences follows the bottom-layered rules of the world.

There are two ways to advance to a higher Sequence in a Pathway: advancing by consuming Beyonder Characteristics, and advancing by praying to an existence for a Boon.

Advancement by Beyonder Characteristics
A Beyonder can use Beyonder Characteristic to advance to a higher sequence. Since Beyonder Characteristics usually have the mental imprints of previous owners, as well as the godhood of the Original Creator, consuming them directly is considered very dangerous and can easily cause the Beyonder to lose control. It is possible to directly become a High Sequence Beyonder by consuming the corresponding characteristic (such as in the case of Sea God Kalvetua), but this is very rare and usually have latent dangers.

There are certain methods or factors that can reduce the risk of losing control:

Acting Method: At each Sequence, the Beyonder can Act according to the sequence name to digest the corresponding potion before attempting to advance to the next Sequence.
The purpose of the Acting Method is to deceive the mental imprint of the Original Creator within the Beyonder Characteristics until one fully digest it.
Potion: When advancing, the Beyonder can concoct a Potion by combining the Beyonder Characteristic with other supplementary ingredients, following the correct Potion formula.
Advancement Ritual: Starting from Sequence 5, the Beyonder needs to carry out an Advancement Ritual to advance to the next Sequence.
The purpose of the ritual is to help the advancing Beyonder anchor and retain their self-consciousness through the sudden increase of Beyonder Characteristics inside their body during the advancement process until they can stabilize again.
Anchor: At High Sequences, the godhood inside the Beyonder Characteristics becomes a serious concern. This issue cannot be solved by the Acting Method; instead, the Beyonder will need to have Anchor to fight against the corruption of godhood.
In essence, the Anchor is also a type of corruption: the image of the deities that the believers knew were different from the actual deities, so it could warp the deities' true image.
The purpose of the Anchor is to form an intricate balance with the influence of the mental imprint within the Beyonder Characteristic, allowing the Beyonders to barely maintain their humanity.
Similarities to the Previous Owner: At High Sequence, the mental imprints of the previous owner of the Beyonder Characteristics will be very powerful. If the Soul Body of the advancing Beyonder is sufficiently similar to the mental imprints of the previous owner of the characteristic, it can effectively decrease the difficulty of advancements. However, this has the risk of the current owner becoming more and more similar to the previous owner. For example:
A descendant that looks similar to their High Sequence ancestor will be considered as having talents and will have an easier time to advance. However, in this case, one will likely unknowingly suffer an identity dissociation, and they would slowly transform into a monster stitched at the soul level. It‚Äôs just like that High-Sequence Beyonder who resurrected on his body.[3]
Since the God of Death is still widely regarded as the embodiment of death in the Northern Continent and Southern Continent, "His" descendants can borrow "His" name to shape themselves and complete the Sequence 1 Pale Emperor ritual. The drawback is that they will grow increasingly similar to the God of Death‚Äîuntil they become "Him".[7]
Switching Pathways
Usually, for a Beyonder, drinking potions of a different Pathway is akin to taking poison, where the best outcome is a half-mad state. However, according to the Law of Similar Sequence Beyonder Characteristic, at High Sequence, a Beyonder can switch to a Neighboring/Adjacent Pathway in the same Above the Sequence group without the danger of losing control, or the accumulation of madness[8]. In theory, it's also possible to switch at a lower Sequence, but the risk of losing control is much higher. But if successful, it might not result in half-crazed madness or loss of control after the switch.

If a Beyonder successfully switches pathways, they keep all of their powers from the previous Pathway. These old, previous pathway powers will then be fused together with the powers provided by their current, new pathway potion. It creates a certain level of mutation, creating unique and bizarre powers. This makes them more troublesome to deal with, making it very hard for enemies to be prepared. 

When switching pathways, the powers gained from the new pathway will depends on the set of characteristic that is used to advance. Missing characteristic of lower sequence will lead to lost of some of the corresponding abilities. Whether the current characteristic includes upgraded abilities from the previous sequence will also influence which abilities the Beyonder get. Under usual circumstances, sticking to a single pathway until the end was generally the better choice than switching to a neighboring pathway. This is because the acting acquired in the earlier Sequences were deeply ingrained in that pathway, making it easier and safer to advance in the same pathway.

To switch Pathways at higher Sequences, there are hidden conditions to some degree, stemming from the lack of previous Sequence elements. For example, there are no implicit, hidden ritual conditions a Sequence 3 Beyonder who progressed step-by-step along the Red Priest Pathway needs to fulfill to advance to Sequence 2 of the same Pathway - the previous Sequences have already provided the corresponding enhancements. But a Sequence 3 Beyonder of the Demoness Pathway wanting to make the jump to the Red Priest Pathway must fulfil the implicit, hidden conditions.

After switching Pathway, the Beyonder will still be affected by the God of the old Pathway, but the degree will decrease significantly.
Advancement by Boons

Gods and Angels can bestow Boons (ÊÅ©Ëµê, ƒínc√¨) (the gift of Beyonder powers) to a Recipient without the need for a potion. However, the higher the number of Boon receivers, the greater the burden to the bestower, to the point of affecting "Their" state.[16]

Accepting a Boon comes with both benefits and drawbacks. While the Boon Recipient gains Beyonder abilities, they will also become closer to the corresponding God in mind, body, and spirit.[16] This is because if the power bestowed doesn't contain the bestower's will, it will be challenging for the bestowed to control it, and it will quickly dissipate.

On the Recipient, the Boon's effects concentrate on the body and mind. It can cause one's personality to shift. The more Boons a person takes, the more severe the change will be, especially if they can‚Äôt handle it. If the Recipient's body cannot handle the Boon, they would either turn into a monster, become a puppet of an unknown entity, or transform into someone else who‚Äôd treat things they cherished in the past with indifference.

Additionally, as these powers are a gift from a superior being, "They" can take it back at any time unless the Recipient possesses the unique power of certain Pathways and secretly complete a certain level of stealing while still having the gift.

Interactions between Boons and Beyonder Characteristics
Beyonders with Beyonder Characteristics could receive Boons, although the process carries various complications.[19] This is because the Boon will transform the Beyonder's body to match that of the bestower, but since the Beyonder's body has already adapted to their existing Beyonder Characteristics, there will be a conflict until they find a new balance. However, this conflict won‚Äôt affect their mind or spirit, so they won‚Äôt lose control unless they're on the brink of collapse, but there could be physical changes. If the power bestowed on the Beyonder don't last for a long time, or the corresponding level is not very high, the little changes in the body can be ignored. If the Boon is from the same or a neighboring pathway, it won‚Äôt cause any conflict, but there could still be physical changes.

Boon Recipients can also acquire additional abilities by consuming Potions on top of their Boon. However, they must choose the appropriate potion or a suitable alternative.

Certain Boons are compatible with certain Beyonder Characteristics and will reduce the chance of losing control.
Boons can be given together with tangible Beyonder Characteristics.

Standard Pathways
The 22 Standard Pathways refers to the 22 Pathways present on Earth from the First Epoch, after the Original Creator awakened and split. Details of the 22 Standard Pathways are recorded on the Blasphemy Slates. Among the 22 Pathways, 16 originated directly from the Original Creator, while 6 were split off from the 3 Outer Deities who are direct descendants of the Original Creator and attracted to Earth.

Beyonders of Standard Pathways belonging to Outer Deities don't need to worry too much about the Original Creator awakening in their bodies since the corresponding Beyonder Characteristics didn't directly come from "Him". In the early stages of history, this is an advantage to them because they didn't need to divert a large part of energy to resist the will of the Original Creator. Moreover, back then, the barrier around Earth was still strong enough to prevent the Outer Deities from exerting too much influence. But as time passes, this advantage gradually became a problem. As the barrier became weaker, the Outer Deities' intrusion on reality and their corresponding Pathways on Earth deepened, making it easier for Beyonders of these Pathways to be corrupted.[21] Among the 6 Pathways originated from Outer Deities, the Justiciar Pathway and Black Emperor Pathway are relatively better since the corresponding Outer Deity - the Son of Chaos - had gone silent, as though "He" had disappeared.

Towards the end of the Fifth Epoch, as The Apocalypse approaches, advancing has become easier due to the weakening of the Original Creator's will. This is the reasons why Gods and Kings of Angels start taking concrete actions towards aiming for Above the Sequence. In the year 1358 of the Fifth Epoch, at Sequence 9 and Sequence 8, consuming the Beyonder Characteristics directly is only about 20 to 30% more dangerous than concocting a potion.

Gods of the Standard Pathways can also give Boon. However, even though the Orthodox Gods had the ability to give Boon, these blessings of the Orthodox Gods in this aspect are basically temporary and limited to a certain extent. This is because giving the Boon can be a burden to "Them", and also that the Boon can negatively affect "Their" believers. Similarly, the 7 semi-active Sefirot in the Western Continent can also grant supernatural powers to the prayers.

2.content:
Sequence (Â∫èÂàó, X√πli√®) is the basic hierarchical classification of Beyonders among the Paths to the Divine. The higher the Sequence, the closer the Beyonder is to divinity and the greater abilities are manifested. The first and last Sequences are usually used as the name of their associated Pathway. The concept of Sequences was established on Earth with the appearance of the First Blasphemy Slate and the differentiation of the 22 Standard Pathways. Each Pathway has a total of 10 Sequences from the lowest Sequence 9 to the highest Sequence 0. This is applicable to both Standard Pathways and Non-Standard Pathways, so in a way, this division into Sequences follows the bottom-layered rules of the world.[2] In the potion system introduced by the First Blasphemy Slate, a Beyonder requires the Acting Method to adapt themselves to the potion of its respective Sequences. The Second Blasphemy Slate born after the fall of the Ancient Sun God renamed some Sequences.

Sequence 0 can modify the abilities of different Sequences in the pathway to some extent. Not only Sequence 0 can do such things; certain Kings of Angels can too. Amon, for instance, once altered the mystical knowledge and some abilities acquired in different Sequences of the Error Pathway, transforming the original, full version abilities into benefiting "Him" for other subsequent Beyonders of the same pathway.The classifications of the Sequences in the Fifth Epoch are as followed:

Low-Sequence: Sequences 9 and 8.
Mid-Sequence: Sequences 7 to 5.
High-Sequence (also known as Demigods): Sequences 4 to Sequence 1.
Saints: Sequences 4 and Sequence 3.
Angels: Sequences 2 and Sequence 1.
Kings of Angels: Sequence 1 Angels who have accommodated more than 1 Sequence 1 characteristics and/or have accommodated the Uniqueness of the pathway.
True Gods: Sequence 0.
Additionally, there is another level above Sequence 0 named Great Old One that transcends the Sequences.

Levels of Sequences
Low-Sequence
A thousand years ago, Low-Sequence refers to Sequence 9, Sequence 8 and Sequence 7 Beyonders. As for the current epoch, it refers to Sequence 9 and Sequence 8.

These sequences are the starting point of the Sequence chain as a Beyonder. Low-Sequence Beyonders are no match for guns, much less cannons. They are just more fascinating and indefensible than firearms. Almost all the ritualistic magic they can perform is the seeking of external powers and help. Nevertheless, even the weakest Beyonder can be impressive in their own domains.

In the Fifth Epoch, obtaining a Sequence 9 potion formula is relatively easy, at Beyonder Gatherings. However the circle of Beyonders is very scattered, and most people don‚Äôt know about the acting method or the three Laws of Indestructibility, Conservation and Convergence.

For Beyonders below Sequence 7 of the potion system, there‚Äôs not much that can be done to save up more money than a Sequence 6 potion formula so quickly, and most of them are gray areas that border on breaking the law.[7]

Mid-Sequence
Mid-Sequence refers to Sequence 7, Sequence 6 and Sequence 5 Beyonders. In the Fourth Epoch, it refers to Sequence 6 and 5. Mid-Sequence is the more common period when a Beyonder initially faces madness hidden within the non-Outer Deities pathways, upon advancement.

Their powers are starting to become more powerful, convoluted, and conceptualized. Some sequences might still be unable to match or survive a cannon, but they tend to outperform guns and other conventional weaponry in most ways. At this point, they can truly be considered supreme and mystical entities in the eyes of regular people.

Beginning at Sequence 5 of the potion system, advancement will require a ritual in addition to the potion ingredients. Otherwise, there are extremely high chances of losing control, even with full digestion.

Below High-Sequences, different pathways' sequences have their own characteristics which didn‚Äôt overlap. Each of them had their own strengths and weaknesses, and their strengths and weaknesses were all very obvious. Shepherds were ranked first below High-Sequences.

High-Sequence refers to Sequence 4, Sequence 3, Sequence 2 and Sequence 1 Beyonders, also called Demigods and are subdivided into Saints and Angels.

Sequence 4 is the beginning point of the higher Sequences. It is said that merely achieving such a level brings about qualitative changes in vitality and energy, as well as the attainment of a measure of "godhood". They gain the unique Mythical Creature Form of their respective pathway. Sequences 4 and Sequence 3 have incomplete Mythical Creature Forms while Sequences 2 and Sequence 1 have complete ones. High-Sequence Beyonders' Soul Body experiences a qualitatively change and gains a certain level of divinity to it, allowing them to remain even in death or when their powers are dispersed in the form of Evil Spirits.

High-Sequence Beyonders can influence corresponding lower Sequence Beyonders of the same Sequence pathway to a certain extent.

Saints
Saints refers to Sequence 4 and Sequence 3 Beyonders. Beyonders at this level gain great lifespan, it varies depending on their pathways, but most cannot live longer than 500 years. Their Mythical Creature Form is incomplete, and cannot be used without severe consequences. Female Saints and above can stop their menstruation cycle.

At Sequence 4 and higher, Beyonders can exchange to a neighboring pathway in the same Above the Sequence group. The only known exception is the Lord of Mysteries group, as sequences in this group are only exchangeable starting from Sequence 3.

At Sequence 3 and higher, the Beyonder gain the capability to respond to prayers within a certain area by creating an Honorific Name that points to them. Due to their different personalities, experiences, and characteristics, the corresponding honorific names are essentially different, while their area can be greater depending on their pathway.

Angels 

Angels (Â§©‰Ωø, TiƒÅnsh«ê) refer to Sequence 1 and 2 Beyonders. "They" are complete mythical creatures and require an anchor to prevent "Them" from going mad. "They" can respond to prayers all over the world and were once known as Subsidiary Gods in ancient times. Those who accommodate more than one Sequence 1 Beyonder characteristic or the Uniqueness of "Their" pathway or some control over their corresponding Sefirot are known as Kings of Angels.

Each pathway can only have at most three Sequence 1 angels. If there is a Sequence 0 of this pathway, it usually means there are no Sequence 1 angels and that the second highest Sequence of this pathway is Sequence 2. There are a few exceptions: for example, a Sequence 0 Visionary can separate two of "His" Sequence 1 characteristic to an imagined entity while filling the gap in their own Beyonder characteristic with two imagined characteristics.

If a pathway has three Sequence 1 Angels, the corresponding Sequence 2 Angels can only number six to eight, with the specific amount varying by pathway. This is on the assumption that each of the Sequence 1 Angels possess a Sequence 2 Beyonder characteristic of the same pathway.

In the canon of the seven major Churches, they were filled with legends of Angels and Saints. Angels are depicted with distinct characteristics‚Äîtypically adorned with a pair of pure white wings on their backs, though some may possess as many as two, three, or even six pairs of such wings. In the Church of the Evernight Goddess‚Äô bible, a clear distinction is made between angels and archangels, the latter referring to Sequence 1. As described in the various Church canons, an archangel has twelve pairs of wings.

General Powers/Characteristics of Angels
Complete Mythical Creature: "Their" Mythical Creature Form becomes complete, "Their" truest form. This has many advantages:
"They" appearance will never age and no longer need to eat or drink to survive.
"They" can still die of old age due to the symbolisms of Decay, Death and Passage of Time, but most have abilities that can help themselves to extend their lives.
Even if all True Gods and Great Old Ones symbolizing Death, Decay, and Termination did not exist, "They"' will still die.
"They" can use "Their" Mythical Creature Form at will and without danger to "Themselves".
Revealing "Their" Mythical Creature Form results in a significant increase in power.
World Prayers: "They" are able to answer prayers from all over the world.
Characteristics Shattering: "They" can temporarily shatter Beyonder Characteristics, eliminating any corruption within and separating the lower and higher Sequences.
Resistance to Sefirot: "They" can resist the Sefirot's ability to establish a connection through the knowledge of "Their" existence, mainly in three ways:
"They" could use the status and strength of a complete Mythical Creature.
"They" could suppress "Their" Anchors, using the mental imprint the Original Creator left in "Them" to offset the corruption.
If "They" are in control of a Sefirah "Themselves", "They" could use "Their" Sefirah's aura.
Spirit World Travel: With positioning, Angels could directly traverse the spirit world.[
Symbolic Existence: "They" become a symbol of certain phenomena at Sequence 1.
While in a battle between Angels, this symbol doesn't play a decisive role, it influences the outcome.
"They" are able to cast "Their" gaze into the Astral World.
Boon Bestowal: Existences at the level of Angels or above can bestow Boons.

Kings of Angels (Â§©‰Ωø‰πãÁéã, TiƒÅnsh«ê zhƒ´ w√°ng) are individuals who possess two or more Sequence 1 Beyonder characteristics, or have accommodated the Uniqueness, or hold the Uniqueness along with one or more Sequence 1 Beyonder characteristics. A Sequence 0 is made up by the Uniqueness and three Sequence 1 characteristics, so missing any of them prevents the Beyonder from being considered as a true deity, and "They" can only be considered as a King of Angels.

Many Gods had been Kings of Angels before "They" attained Godhood. In addition, a King of Angels who has direct or indirect control of a Sefirah and thus able to borrow near-Sequence 0 powers of "Their" pathway and below-Sequence 0 powers of "Their" neighboring pathways can be considered a King of King of Angels and is very close to the level of a true deity.

Sequence 0: True God

True Gods (ÁúüÁ•û, Zhƒìnsh√©n) are the Sequence 0s of "Their" respective Pathways. When a God obtains all authorities of "Their" respective pathway, neighboring pathways, and the corresponding Sefirah, then "They" will become a "Great Old One".

To become a True God, one has to consume all three Sequence 1 Beyonder Characteristics and the Uniqueness of their respective pathway, and carry out the corresponding apotheosis ritual. The function of the ascension ritual is to maintain self-awareness; it is not a prerequisite to achieve a qualitative change through aggregation of Beyonder Characteristics.[1] If a Beyonder only wishes to accommodate the Uniqueness to become a King of Angels, the corresponding ritual can be simplified and won't be as difficult. However, when "They" attempt to advance to Sequence 0, even if "They" have accommodated the Uniqueness and absorb three Sequence 1 Beyonder characteristics on separate occasions, "They" will still have to hold a ritual[2] to maintain self-awareness.

The Ancient Gods of the Second Epoch didn‚Äôt advance according to the Pathway System, but were born directly for some unknown reason. "Their" characteristics were a mix of Sequence 1 Beyonder characteristics from other Pathways, or even more than one. "They" are known for "Their" madness, cruelty, violence, and bloodlust because in most cases, "Their" characteristics are from non-neighboring Pathways. There‚Äôs a significant difference between the Ancient Gods and subsequent True Gods, but this doesn‚Äôt mean that "They" are weak. "They" might even be stronger.
Authorities and Traits of True Gods
All General Powers/Characteristics of Angels, at a higher level.
All "Their" lower abilities can be used on the level of authorities, however, whether it's used at this level or not depends on "Their" wills.
Authority Dominion: ‚ÄúThey‚Äù have complete control over the authority of "Their" Pathway.
Pathway Influence: Having accommodated the Uniqueness - the manifestation of the authority of a Pathway - "They" can directly influence Beyonders of the same Pathway, no matter where they are in the world. This includes, but not limited to:
Modifying the Sequence abilities within their pathways to some extent.[5]
Making lower-sequence Beyonders of the same pathway hear murmurings.
Directly interfering to increase the chance of losing control when someone consumes a potion to advance.[6][7]
Manifesting imageries in their dreams.
Unique Existence: It is impossible for another God of the same Pathway to exist, whether in a mirror or a painting.[8]
Due to the Unique nature of the Uniquenesses, the authority derived from "Their" Uniquenesses cannot be used by two bodies simultaneously. This results in different restrictions for different abilities.
While the main body is using the authority, no other clone can do so.[9]
For example, only one Marionette of the Fool, or one Avatar of the Error can use the Uniqueness' Authority at a time, with the main body's authority entering a passive state, however, this doesn't include the abilities that allows the main body itself to exist in different places at the same time, such as Blink of the Door.
For abilities that can borrow power from the Uniqueness, or share it, only one person can use the authority at a time.
Only one Soldier of the Red Priest, can use the shared Uniqueness' authority at a time.
Sinner's Past authority and Discerner's Psychological Cue authority cannot borrow the power of the Uniqueness unless the current holder gives "Them" the permission and "Their" authority enters a passive state.
Abilities that can replicate others using different methods cannot replicate a Uniqueness holder.
Uniquenesses holders cannot be brought from the Historical Void, cannot be Painted, and don't have Mirror Selves.
However, if the Uniquenesses holders "Themselves" descend in the Historical Projection, the Historical Projection will be able to use the Uniqueness.
After accommodating the Uniqueness, even "Their" death imprint in the River of Eternal Darkness remains unique, resulting in only one death imprint, regardless of "Their" deaths count.
Boon Bestowal: Gods can bestow the gift of Beyonder powers to "Their" believers without the need for a potion, however, this is a burden to "Them". It can only be used as a temporary measure. The more people who need a blessing, the greater the burden, it might even affect "Their" state. Those who are bestowed will also suffer disadvantages, such as becoming closer to the corresponding God in mind, body and spirit.[14]
Symbolic Influence: "Their" mere presence causes changes to the nearby environment. The changes that take place depend on the authority that the God controls at that moment.
Biological Immortality: At Sequence 0, "They" do not have a limited lifespan, and will not experience decay and death through the passage of time.
Size Manipulation: "They" can manipulate their own size. "They" can shrink down to human size and grow up to be as tall as a mountain.[16] Depending on the Pathway, some True Gods can become as large as a star or as small as a speck of light.
Divine Kingdom: "They" can create "Their" own complete Divine Kingdom, a personal space separated from outside. Depending on their authorities, "They" can change the rules inside and impose them even on other Gods.
Astral World: As the embodiment of "Their" corresponding authorities, "They" can access the Astral World, an abstract plane of authorities and symbolism.
"They" can travel through it.
"They" can modify and control concepts and symbolism through it.
Mythical Creature Form Alteration: "They" can change the Mythical Creature Form of "Their" respective Pathway.
Three-Line Honorific Name: Only Gods or Angels who once accommodated an Uniqueness can use a three-line honorific name. Although their honorific name often won't be limited to three lines, when chanting or praying one could choose only three.
If a True God is willing, "They" can create a mystical language with specific functions.
A Dual-Pathway True God is definitely stronger than two Single-Pathway True Gods combined


Above the Sequence: Great Old One

Above the Sequence is an umbrella term that refers to any level above Sequence 0 (i.e., levels that involve the Sefirot). Great Old One refers to the complete level where one has fully fused with the corresponding Sefirah, and has accommodated the Uniqueness and 1 Sequence 1 Characteristic of all Pathways within the group.

On Earth, based on the 22 Standard Pathways, only 9 Great Old Ones can exist, corresponding to the 9 Sefirot. In the Cosmos, there also exist Outer Deities who are Great Old Ones over Non-Standard Pathways that do not belong to the 22 Standard Pathways on Earth. Beyonders on Earth can advance to a higher Sequence of these Non-Standard Pathways not by relying on Beyonder Characteristics, but by praying to the corresponding Outer Deities to become Boon Recipients.

3.content:
Uniqueness (ÂîØ‰∏ÄÊÄß, Unique Trait/Characteristic, W√©iyƒ´x√¨ng) is the unique characteristic of a Pathway, and is the most important ingredient for promoting to Sequence 0. Uniqueness is also referred to as the symbolism or authority of the corresponding Pathway.

Uniquenesses are typically abstract items or concepts. They can Come to Life and exist on their own, exist in the form of an Item or Sealed Artifact with limited or no consciousness, or be Accommodated inside a Beyonder.

To become a True God and gain complete authority over the respective Pathway, a Beyonder needs to Accommodate the Uniqueness and all three Sequence 1 Beyonder Characteristic of that Pathway. To become a Great Old One, one has to merge with the corresponding Sefirah and Accommodate all Uniquenesses and at least one Sequence 1 Beyonder Characteristic of each Pathway in the group.

Unique Existence
Normally, at any moment in time, the Uniqueness and things related to them are Unique. For example:

A Scholar of Yore cannot summon anything associated with the Uniqueness from the Historical Void.
Normally, someone who died and resurrected multiple times will have multiple death imprints within the River of Eternal Darkness. But after "They" accommodated a Uniqueness, "Their" death imprint also becomes unique.
The authority derived from the Uniqueness cannot be used by two bodies simultaneously. While the main body is using it, no other replicated body can do so.
For example, only one Marionette of the Fool, or one Soldier of the Red Priest, can use "Their" Uniqueness' authority at a time.[10]
A Sinner can only return to a past state that involves the Uniqueness if "They" receive permission from the current holder of said Uniqueness.
There are certain cases where one can use the corresponding Sefirah to either manifest fake Uniquenesses under the Sefirah, or to manifest the symbolisms and powers of one:

When a Visionary first gained control of the Chaos Sea and accommodated a second Uniqueness and corresponding Sequence 1 Beyonder Characteristics to a certain extent, ‚ÄúHe‚Äù could "Envision" the remaining, fake Uniquenesses of the God Almighty group, and accommodated them. Similarly, a God Almighty can Create Uniquenesses from the Pathways of the God Almighty group.
Indestructibility
Normally, Uniquenesses cannot be divided, copied, or destroyed, unless when they encounter the Original Creator.

Activation
Activation or Coming to Life (Ê¥ªÂåñ, Becoming Active, Hu√≥hu√†) refers to the Uniqueness becoming active and is able to exert the powers and authorities of their Pathway. How much powers and authorities the Uniqueness can exert depends on its level of Activation.

A Uniqueness that has fully Come to Life and gaining consciousness can be considered a weaker version of a Sequence 0, "They" just lack the necessary support to exert the full strength of one. "They" would be stronger than a King of Angels who has Accommodated the Uniqueness, because the King of Angels has to suppress and control the Uniqueness to reach a balance with the Godhood inside it, thus the Uniqueness within "Them" isn't fully Activated.

For cases like Amon (without the Ancient Sun God's restrictions) or the Hidden Sage where the Uniqueness itself has fully Come to Life and became sentient, "They" would be stronger than Bethel Abraham, who had Accommodated the Uniqueness and all three Sequence 1 Beyonder Characteristics but sealed "Himself" to prevent becoming a Sequence 0.
A Uniqueness that has Come to Life, such as the Artificial Death and the Hidden Sage, can act as the God of the corresponding Pathway. Compared to the Hidden Sage, the Artificial Death has not fully Come to Life, so its influence on the Pathway is relatively limited.

Accommodation
Accommodation (ÂÆπÁ∫≥, Accommodate/Contain, R√≥ngn√†) refers to the process where a Beyonder fuses and takes control of the Uniqueness to gain the authority of the corresponding Pathway.

At the Uniqueness and Sequence 0 level, the potion can be digested through acting, but it shouldn't be fully digested. This is because digestion means getting closer to the original nature of the Godhood, so if one digests, it's easy to lose their sense of self, defeated by Godhood. The best way is to Accommodate and control it instead, to reach a balance with the Godhood inside.[18]
There are three ways to Accommodate the Uniqueness

Born naturally with the Uniqueness, which is equivalent to being a Uniqueness Coming to Life and imbuing human nature into it.
Make the Uniqueness Come to Life to a certain extent before forcefully putting it into one's body. By relying on the power of an Above the Sequence existence to suppress it, it will take some time to slowly wear the Uniqueness down before one gets used to it and achieve a balance.
Concoct the Uniqueness into an incomplete potion and drink it with a simplified apotheosis ritual.
Once the Uniqueness has been Accommodated by a Beyonder, "They" can change the Uniqueness' corresponding concepts and symbols over and over, allowing them to change their form forever to the possessor's preferences. As a God, some Uniquenesses manifest as part of one's body or belongings; others remain hidden. "They" could let the Uniqueness display the influence of godhood as and when "They" want it to; for example, "They" can make it so people who witnessed the Uniqueness would not lose control and go crazy.

A King of Angels who has Accommodated the Uniqueness of "Their" Pathway can be considered Half a True God and can shorten "Their" Honorific Names to three lines similar to a True God. Once a Beyonder has successfully Accommodated the Uniqueness at a previous point in time, as long as no one has Accommodated "Their" former Uniqueness, "Their" level would not drop and "Their" former Honorific Name would still point towards "Them", even if "They" have perished and become a special existence, such as the Evil Spirit Sauron-Einhorn-Medici.

Depending on the Uniqueness' Activation level, a King of Angels with only the Uniqueness could be far stronger than a King of Angels with Beyonder Characteristics.

4.content:
Mythical Creature Form (Á•ûËØùÁîüÁâ©ÂΩ¢ÊÄÅ, Sh√©nhu√†shƒìngw√π X√≠ngt√†i) is a transformation and a species category introduced in the Lord of Mysteries. Every demigod, including Saints and Angels, have their own Pathway's Mythical Creature Form. A Mythical Creature is the divine form of a Sequence 4 or higher Beyonder. Beyonders at Sequence 4 and 3 only possesses an incomplete Mythical Creature Form; only at Sequence 2 and above does a Beyonder become a true Mythical Creature.A Mythical Creature Form is not something that could be described superficially or in three-dimensions, as apart from quantitative terms like length, width, height, they're also a potpourri of complex knowledge, godhood characteristics, and secret symbols. Ordinary people and Beyonders below Sequence 4 will suffer tremendous damage from simply glancing at a Mythical Creature, without any godhood they will be corrupted by the spirituality, having their minds thrashed. A common outcome would either be death on the spot or going completely mad. And as the demigod grows in strength, the damage only grows more potent and irresistible. Therefore, creatures at this level have to constantly control themselves to not expose this form, or just from their very existence alone, it can bring about a catastrophe to their surroundings. However, if they can control themselves they can expose this form without it impacting people around them and their surroundings.[1][2][3]

Demigod Beyonders that can utilize their Mythical Creature form are capable of suppressing Beyonders from the same pathway and from the same sequence.[4]

The insanity and mutation from witnessing a Mythical Creature not only produce the symptoms of losing control of one‚Äôs pathway, but it also comes with the traits of the other party‚Äôs Sequence.

For example, observing the Mythical Creature Form of a Beyonder from the Sun Pathway will cause the observer to combust, and observing a Beyonder of the Demoness Pathway will cause the observer to become a Demoness.[5]
However, those who survive the impact from witnessing the Mythical Creature Form directly can learn corresponding potion formulas and understand the Beyonder powers of this existence.[6]

Form Differences
The Mythical Creature Form of Saints (Sequence 4 and 3 Beyonders) is incomplete. They only possess some racial characteristics of their Mythical Creature Form. Only Beyonders at Sequence 2 and above possess a true Mythical Creature Form.

Before becoming a complete Mythical Creature, a Saint will still be hungry and thirsty, but for a Sequence 3 demigod, it is bearable for half a month without supplementary food and water. As for the complete Mythical Creature Form, eating is just a hobby rather than a necessity.

A complete Mythical Creature can die of old age, but rarely

5.content:
Sefirot (Ê∫êË¥® Yu√°nzh√¨, Source Quality) are collections of symbols, sources of authority, and origins of power. To be considered a Great Old One that's Above the Sequence, one needs to accommodate the corresponding Sefirah and all corresponding Uniquenesses, plus one Sequence 1 Beyonder Characteristic from each corresponding Pathway.[1]

The Ancient Gods believed that the Original Creator left nine legacies behind on Earth, which are derived from some part of his body. They might be kingdoms, cities, rivers, oceans, keys, etc.[2] In reality, six of the nine Sefirot on Earth originated from the Original Creator, and the remaining three came from the three Outer Deities who are direct descendants of the Original Creator. There are specific records on the Second Blasphemy Slate regarding the Sefirot and the secrets of Above the Sequence.

According to Amon, the nine Sefirot on Earth are either completely illusory and hidden somewhere unknown, or they're definitely real while existing in the real world. The Chaos Sea is the only Sefirah that merges the real and the illusory and has an entrance in the real world.

The two Sefirot River of Eternal Darkness and City of Calamity are the symbols of the hidden Fourth Pillar. However, it wasn't the birth of the Fourth Pillar that would bring about the end of the universe, but the universe reaching its true apocalypse that would give rise to the Fourth Pillar symbolizing the final end.[3] The existence of the Fourth Pillar is also the reason why the Pathways under the Eternal Darkness group and the Calamity of Destruction groups are exchangeable. However, doing so leaves sone unable to ascend to a Great Old One, unless they think of a way to separate the Beyonder characteristics from before.

The Law of Beyonder Characteristics Convergence is also applicable to Sefirot. This causes things and people related to the different Sefirot to be attracted to each other.Unique Existence
Normally, at any moment in time, the Sefirot and things related to them are Unique. For example, if a marionette or avatar of a Great Old One uses the power of a Sefirah, "Their" other avatars cannot use it at the same time.

Indestructibility
Normally, like Uniquenesses, Sefirot cannot be divided, copied, or destroyed. They can be damaged, but specific part/essence of them are truly indestructible. Overtime, the Sefirot will heal any damage done to it.

Sefirot can only be permanently damaged, split apart, or destroyed by:

Encountering the Original Creator, who can make the impossible possible.
Encountering the Fourth Pillar, which holds the Termination symbolism that represents the end of all things and the universe.
Self-Completion
For a Sefirah that was split apart into separate portions, initially those portions are incomplete. However, since torn Sefirot have the ability to mend themselves, over time, both the portion that stayed with the original Great Old One and the portion that was split away would eventually self-complete. As a result, the original Great Old One would still be a complete Great Old One (although "They" would lose certain associated symbolisms), and the Sefirah that was split away can be used to create a new Great Old One.

In the Pre-Epoch, in "His" sleep, the Original Creator had naturally split into multiple personas, each corresponding to a different Great Old One. They were also in a state of slumber, but they began to use the authority and Beyonder Characteristics they controlled to influence the world, making many preparations for the true dissociation when the Original Creator awakened.[12] For example, the Celestial Worthy of Heaven and Earth for Blessings had captured humans in the modern era into the Sefirah Castle as a part of "His" backup resurrection plan. The Ancient Sun God also fell into the Chaos Sea during this era.

At the end of the Pre-Epoch, the Original Creator awakened, causing three Sefirot and six Pathways to be sucked to Earth from the Outer Deities in the Cosmos. In the First Epoch, some of the active Great Old Ones were Outer Deities who had been directly attracted to Earth, and some came alive as Sefirot. In other words, some Great Old Ones were equivalent to the Original Creator - embodiments of the different personalities "He" split into.[5]

After the Original Creator awakened, "His" two dominant split entities - the Primordial God Almighty and the Celestial Worthy of Heaven and Earth for Blessings - leveraged "Their" long-prepared ancient schemes across the times of the Old Earth to gradually gain advantages in "Their" fight against the other Sefirot. The two Pillars eventually defeated the other Sefirot and shattered "Their" wills (excluding the Brood Hive and the Key of Light),[13] making those wills take a very long time to recover and awaken again.[14]

In the early-mid stages of the First Epoch, the Celestial Worthy of Heaven and Earth for Blessings and the Primordial God Almighty had used different methods to grasp the additional Sefirot. The Celestial Worthy accommodated the Nation of Disorder and the River of Eternal Darkness, while the Primordial God Almighty accommodated the City of Calamity[15] and the Tenebrous World[16]. This made "Their" inclination to converge more intense, making it impossible for "Them" to control "Themselves", until "They" began taking actions against each other. Since then, the two Great Old Ones that could be called Pillars had completely disappeared, and the rest of the Sefirot other than the Chaos Sea and the Sefirah Castle had been sealed in the Western Continent by the Celestial Worthy.[12]

Along with the fading will of the Original Creator, the seal on the Western Continent gradually weakened with time. The Sefirot would instinctively or consciously corrode the Uniqueness and High-Sequence Beyonder Characteristics within their symbolic range to influence the outside world. The first to seep out energy was the River of Eternal Darkness, which formed a distributary through the Phoenix Ancestor Gregrace in the Second Epoch. After that, in the Fourth Epoch, more Sefirot traces began to appear on the Northern and Southern Continents and the islands over the Five Seas. This is an important factor hidden behind many of the anomalies in this era.[12] For example:

Salinger had tried to use the River of Eternal Darkness' distributary in the outside world to fuse with the  Red Priest Uniqueness to create a brand new Great Old One path, but "He" failed and went mad. "He" wasn't able to resist the convergence desire for the Twilight and Evernight pathways, causing "Him" to target the Orthodox Gods and start the Pale Era.[12]
The City of Calamity left reflections outside the Western Continent: the headquarters of the Medici Family was situated on Bansy Harbor,[12] the Fourth Epoch Trier where Alista Tudor perished, and the city Morora where Salinger's Blood Banner was sealed.
The Nation of Disorder corrupted the  Justiciar Uniqueness, forming the Trunsoest Brass Book.[17].
The River of Eternal Darkness has various distributaries, such as in Fourth Epoch Trier and Calder√≥n City.
The Knowledge Moor left remnants in the Fourth Epoch Trier and in Avalon. The birth of the Hidden Sage is related to the Brood Hive's influence on the Knowledge Moor on the Western Continent.
On the Western Continent, the Sefirot become the basis for the Orthodox Sect System to gain supernatural power, through praying to different semi-active Sefirot for Boons. After the fusion and influence of generations of Dao Integrators in the Western Continent, the Sefirot also developed "Their" own consciousnesses.

The Nation of Disorder became the thirty-three-layered Heavenly Court. Its consciousness came alive as the Celestial Thearch.
The River of Eternal Darkness became the Netherworld / Yellow Springs,and was the Sefirah of the Haoli Sect.
The Key of Light became the Buddhist Kingdom of Light, and was the Sefirah of the sects of the monastic community. Its consciousness came alive as the Golden Buddha.
The Knowledge Moor was the Sefirah of the Celestial Master's sect.
The City of Calamity's consciousness came alive as the Malevolent Dragon.
The Tenebrous World became the Sefirah of the Master of the Shadow Cottage's sect.
The Brood Hive, who had awakened self-awareness in the First Epoch, was worshipped by the Luo Sect as the Unborn Ancient Mother.

keywords: the mysterious space above the Gray Fog
6.content:
The Sefirah Castle (Ê∫êÂ†°, Source Castle, Yu√°nb«éo), previously called the mysterious space above the Gray Fog before Klein Moretti (Zhou Mingrui) knew its name[1] and is also called The Door of Light, is one of the nine Sefirot on Earth, a legacy left behind by the Original Creator and originally owned by the Celestial Worthy of Heaven and Earth for Blessings.

Corresponds to one of the three Pillars, Lord of the Mysteries Group. The Demonic Wolf Flegrea knew its name and tried to get in it in "His" entire life through the Fool Pathway but never succeeded. Therefore, many powerful creatures suspect that the Sefirah Castle doesn't exist and is only an abstract concept.

Klein is able to go above the gray fog through a certain ritual he had learned when he was still in 21st century China. In the Sefirah Castle, Klein holds regular Tarot Club meetings where he poses as Mr. Fool. Once stable, the Sefirah Castle's core appears as a strange door of light mark on humanoid Klein's glabella.

A majestic ancient palace with a vast dome supported by towering stone pillars that stood above the boundless gray fog in the Spirit World. It was later revealed that the true Sefirah Castle is the door of light inside of the palace and the space above the gray fog is the Realm of God that comes with the Sefirah Castle while the ancient palace is made from Klein's thought with the power of "Wishes".[4] The door of light constantly emanated a faint grayish-white fog, The Historical Void.

There is a magnificent palace hall with a vast dome supported by numerous towering stone pillars. It's looked grand and lofty, just like a legendary palace for giants.

Directly under the dome where the gray fog gathered, there is an ancient, long bronze table with ten high-back chairs on either side in a symmetrical arrangement. The back of each chair dazzled and shone faintly with crimson red, drawing the outlines of weird constellations that differed from reality.

The True "Sefirah Castle"

Somewhere within the gray fog, there are steps that lead to a door of light with a bluish-black luster. The door is formed by countless layer of spherical light and each spherical light enveloped transparent or translucent squirming maggots. Behind this door, there is a bluish-black fog, that maybe hiding something unknown and terrifying. There are completely transparent cocoons hanging by thin black threads from the top of the door, and inside the cocoons are souls from every race, wearing modern clothes, some even holding cell phones. All of them has the aura as though they are living but their eyes are tightly closed. Three cocoons are already broken and empty.

In the First Epoch, the former owner, the Celestial Worthy of Heaven and Earth for Blessings sealed people in cocoons in the Sefirah Castle and arranged to release certain ones when certain requirements were met, for his resurrection. But something went wrong, and he wasn't able to resurrect as planned.

In the Second Epoch, Flegrea knew the existence of the Sefirah Castle; this was the name that "He" gave. However, "He" failed to enter Sefirah Castle even to "His" death. Therefore, many powerful creatures suspect that the Sefirah Castle doesn't exist and is only an abstract concept.[2]

Angels and gods of this pathway group also can sense its existence, but no one has found it.[6]

On June 28, 1349, during the Fifth Epoch, when Zhou Mingrui transmigrated into Klein Moretti, the black velvet Curtain was spat out of the Sefirah Castle. The Evernight Goddess indirectly affected the Sefirah Castle through Antigonus to "Tamper" the Curtain to the Forsaken Land of the Gods.[7][8][9]

Klein is able to go above the gray fog through a certain ritual he had learned when he was still in 21st century China.[10] He gains more access to the Sefirot's powers as he progresses along the Beyonder pathway.[11]

After The Fool's Gambit, Klein Moretti is currently in a deep sleep here together with Arrodes.

Mysteries of the Gray Fog
Historical Void is a symbolic object formed from all the history in the Spirit World. [12]

Klein had a guess that he was the Ruler above the Spirit World referred to by the Magical Mirror Arrodes as well as some other beings like the Orange Light Hilarion. It was thought that the reason for this is because he performed the steps leading to his transmigration early on and while still human whereas Roselle Gustav only experimented later in life when "He" was a high-Sequence Beyonder,[13] Klein thinks this was why Roselle could only see the gray fog but not enter or control it.

There seems to be a deeper connection between Transmigrators and the Sefirah Castle. As the current owner of the fog enhances his sequence, steps will appear in the fog leading to the door of light. When the owner becomes a demigod, they can see a portion inside the door: There are various groups of people from every race in deep sleep inside cocoons. Three of them are opened cocoons that Klein theorizes corresponds to three transmigrators, him being the third cocoon and Emperor Roselle being the second. The first cocoon belongs to a female and is later confirmed to be Evernight Goddess.

It seems as though after certain actions are performed or items used, only then can they "escape" the cocoon and enter into the body of a person in the "real world". For example, Roselle got a sliver plate and Klein performed a strange ritual.

It made Klein's transmigration and resurrection possible and granted him powers as he advanced in his sequence. Transmigrators who were released through the Sefirah Castle would soon get contact with the Lord of Mysteries Group, due to the Law of Beyonder Characteristics Convergence.

After promoting to Sequence 2, Klein finally understood that the core of this space is the door of light, which is also the true Sefirah Castle. The space above the gray fog, on the other hand, is the realm of god that comes with the Sefirah Castle.[4]

Power & Abilities
The Sefirah Castle has certain properties that enhance Klein's abilities. He is able to remove interference from divination, enhance his own divination power, shield him from high Beyonders and gods, mythical items.

Items that stay in the Sefirah Castle will be slowly tainted by the aura of the Sefirah Castle that can be detected by some existence (for example Arrodes), and ordinary objects can slowly turn into Sealed Artifacts.

The crimson stars in the gray fog are connected to people in the real world. Some people who own certain objects (such as Audrey's bronze mirror and Cattleya's celestial globe) have a stronger connection to the fog and can be easily drawn into the fog.

After Klein made up Mr. Fool's honorific title, the Sefirah Castle is able to receive prayers and save them for Klein to check-up afterwards. Through rituals, people (including himself) can sacrifice items to him and accept items from him with the help of the Sefirah Castle. Klein can also summon his Spirit Body through a similar process.

Klein's resurrection seems also to be due to the power of the Sefirah Castle.

At Sequence 6

After becoming a Sequence 6: Faceless the gray fog has started to truly integrate with Klein's body in the real world.

At Sequence 3
After promoting to Sequence 3: Scholar of Yore, Klein's power on the gray fog is similar to that of a Sequence 2: Miracle Invoker.
Additionally he can create paper angels of Sequence 2: Miracle Invoker using only the Sefirah Castle's power.
The layout of the Sefirah Castle is projected onto his spirit body allowing him to perceive it in its entirety.
